attributes.action: Remove or greatly increase the petition character limit, currently capped at 880
attributes.background: The current character limit in petition descriptions is too small to include a highly meaningful body of evidence, argument, and other relevant information. Governmental ability to reply to petitions is notably unencumbered. People should be able to engage in responsive dialogue with the government.
attributes.additional_details: Many members of the public are informed on an extensive variety of subjects, ranging from obscure and niche, to popular and general interest. These people are ideally suited to approach the government via petition, to better educate the public and government alike. However, current character limitations means only small fragments of their expertise can be represented. Given the government's latitude in ability to respond to these petitions, the public should be granted similar levels of freedom.

attributes.action: Decision on brexit should need 2nd poll if it involves exit from customs union
attributes.background: The customs union and free trade area were not referred to on the ballot paper in the referendum and could have had an effect on the result if it had been stated on the ballot paper. The UK population should have a final say on all implications if leaving the above is part of the Brexit deal

attributes.action: Require all classrooms to have CCTV to help prevent bullying
attributes.background: Bullying needs to be talked about, and dealt with seriously because kids don't talk because they think no one would believe them. CCTV in classrooms will stop this.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the Government to require all schools to have CCTV and sound equipment in all classrooms, to show children that they take bullying seriously.

attributes.action: Increase national insurance contributions by £5 a person a month to save the NHS
attributes.background:
The NHS is in crisis. I'm sure most if not everyone would be happy to pay an extra £5 a month in national insurance contributions to help save our special health care system. 
We cannot lose the NHS, or is that what the conservative government want...

attributes.action: Let 15 year olds apply for their provisional without having to wait 9 months.
attributes.background: Some teenagers are in stress of having to wait 9 months for a provisional, and I believe that if we lower the age of applying for a provisional, it would really help. Also, if teenagers start driving with experienced drivers at a younger age it would help them drive better in the future.
attributes.additional_details: Also, in emergency cases, if the experienced person is injured or is in need of help the teenager could help by driving to the local hospital or home etc.

attributes.action: Make schools have nit nurses back and children with lice stay home.
attributes.background: Are you sick and tired of your children getting headlice because parents are forced to send their children to school with headlice, as schools see education been more important than health? I certainly am. Help to get nit nurses back into schools.
attributes.additional_details:
Parents of children with headlice are been harrassed to send their children to school and the spread of lice continues. 
They think if a childs hair is tied up they can not be spread. Wrong.
They think as long as your actively trying to get rid of them, the child should be in school. Wrong.
Children with headlice should be kept off school until the headlice are completely gone and the nit nurse should be able to check before allowing a child back into school. 
A once a week visit would sufice.

attributes.action: Incentivise the switch from diesel to electric & low emission petrol vehicles.
attributes.background: Diesel vehicles cause thousands of deaths per year and unnecessarily put huge pressure on the health service. An incentivised scrap & switch scheme for diesel vehicles is the only way the government can ensure pollution is reduced and diesel cars are taken off the road.
attributes.additional_details:
"UK air pollution 'linked to 40,000 early deaths a year'" - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-35629034

"Diesel cars should be phased out to stop pollution deaths, says Chief Medical Officer " - http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/12/30/diesel-cars-should-phased-stop-pollution-deaths-says-chief-medical/

"Five facts about diesel the car industry would rather not tell you" - https://www.transportenvironment.org/sites/te/files/publications/2015_09_Five_facts_about_diesel_FINAL.pdf

attributes.action: Make Ofsted Inspections in Schools a regular, unexpected thing without knowing
attributes.background: Teachers change how they teach and behave when ofsted are at the school. I think that ofsted should be unexpected and should be a last minute thing for teachers to know.

attributes.action: Leaving Care age to be raised to the August after 18th birthday if in education
attributes.background: Care leavers aged 18 in full time education should be classed as 'eligible' or 'relevant' until the 31st August after their 18th Birthday, to be entitled to accommodation and maintenance. This ceases at 18, when they become 'former relevant'. It is unfair to have to study whilst setting up a home.
attributes.additional_details:
The percentage of care leavers in further and higher education is statistically lower than their peers. Being able to manage and complete their education may prove to be a struggle when leaving care.
In terms of child benefit entitlement, a ‘qualifying young person’ can be aged 18 and 19 in full-time education. This extends financial support to young people post-18. Care leavers should have their support extended to the same age as they are some of the most vulnerable people in society.

attributes.action: Make Social Services & Cafcas accountable & transparent by using audio recording
attributes.background: Social Services & Cafcas get it wrong too much. Innocent families have children removed and families needing intervention go ignored. Errors are made in the reports and systems. Interviews not accurately relayed and misinterpreted. They need to be held to account and interviews audio recorded.
attributes.additional_details: Social Services fabricated evidence in my social chronology, misinterpreted information and made duplicate entries without changing dates so it's obvious the errors. Biased opinions are relied on and facts and evidence presented ignored so we are unable to address these. Complaints are passed to nhs and back to Ss. Theses incorrect opinions and documents are relied on. Making complaints is used against us. Cafcas & Social Services also record opinions and misconstrue interview content.

attributes.action: Free childcare hour from their 3rd birthday
attributes.background:
In Scotland children from their 3rd birthday get their free hours of child care but in England we have to wait until the next term.
I would like every child on their 3rd birthday to get their free hours

attributes.action: Introduce a new 'National Health Tax' which is only to be used for NHS.
attributes.background: Most people in the UK seem to be happy with paying extra to fund the NHS. An new NHT would target funds directly to where they are needed and not form part of a central pot. NHT could be applied to the following: Petrol and diesel, Alcohol, tobacco, UK visitors at port of entry (£25.00) etc
attributes.additional_details:
NHT would be in addition to VAT but NOT be applied to direct income.
For example current VAT at 20% could be raised to 21% to include 1% NHT. The government could no longer be blamed for not having enough cash as the NHT would be a disclosed figure and allocated directly. We should also reduce grants to the FA and other organisations not in need and reduce overseas aid. This saving can be converted as an NHT income.

attributes.action: NHS to revert back to using bank nurses and stop using agency nurses.
attributes.background: I am informed by my local MP Rt Hon David Evennett MP that the NHS saved £600 million in the first year of reducing using agency staff.  Obviously to stop this use would be a worthwhile saving particular as the NHS needs the money urgently now.

attributes.action: Amend the Aggravated Murder of and  Violence against Women Bill to include men
attributes.background: The Bill had its first reading in Parliament on the 31st January 2017. The obvious thing that was picked up by one member of parliament, that being Philip Davies, was that he recognised that the bill was sexist. How it got approved is beyond comprehension.

attributes.action: TAX non-reusable sanitary products & give out free reusable pads, cups & nappies
attributes.background:
'Disposable' items such as tampon applicators and wipes pollute our beaches, end up in landfill, and Kill wildlife.
With the revenue generated from the TAX, give out free reusable pads, cups and nappies.
If there is any money leftover this should go towards cleaning the UK coasts of rubbish.
attributes.additional_details:
www.facebook.com/keeptampontax/

https://www.theguardian.com/vital-signs/2015/feb/12/science-plastic-oceans-study-fish-pollution-worse

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/sep/21/flushing-tampons-toilet-blocks-drains-sanitary-products

attributes.action: Student maintenance loans to include parental outgoings as well as incomings
attributes.background: When a student applies for a maintenance loan through Student Finance UK, they have to declare their total annual household income. Whilst this may be effective for the upper and lower class, many of the middle class families lose out substantially.
attributes.additional_details: With a maximum loan of 8,200 for students with an annual household income of less than £25,000, no financial aid is expected of their parents or guardians. However, despite a student turning 18, being a separate legal entity to their parents or guardians, parents are expected to help despite their outgoings. Annual household incomes over £62,177 allow students to be entitled to a £3,821 loan. With accomodation nearly always over this amount, parents are expected to help to the extent of £5,000.

attributes.action: Negotiate freedom of movement with Canada after Britain leaves the EU.
attributes.background: Both Great Britain and Canada would be greatly benefited by having freedom of movement.

attributes.action: Start a Hate Offender's Register,  modelled on the Sex Offender's Register.
attributes.background: Parents should have the right to know if their child runs the risk of being bullied or radicalised by hate preachers in their neighbourhood. A register of hate offenders will empower subjects of Her Majesty to make informed choices on who they may wish to avoid to keep safe and avoid conflict.

attributes.action: Make it law all cars sold  that the driving licence Number of new keeper ON V5
attributes.background: Having a spate of cars bought buy people to use as pool cars for crime and possible have no licence causing havoc in the communites of the UK
attributes.additional_details: Having a spate of cars bought buy people to use as pool cars for crime and possible have no licence causing havoc in the community. Seems selling to anyone with out a licence or the person having no conscious of there actions for a quick turn around of money these cars having no mot with many defects tax or insurance

attributes.action: Introduce free drug purity test kits into Pharmacies across Britain.
attributes.background: Too many young individuals are taking drugs that in most cases are not what they are said to be, leading to cases of serious harm and often death. Drug consumption is not something that can be stopped, but can be made safer with the introduction of these purity testing kits that could save lifes.

attributes.action: Make people register for gig tickets before the sale to stop hackers and touts
attributes.background: Its unfair that true fans are missing out on getting tickets to see their favourite artists due to hackers,computer programmes and touts buying tickets in high volumes and re-selling seconds after the tours selling out for extortionate amounts, lets make a registration like glastonbury stand for all

attributes.action: Stop GM wheat planting in the UK!
attributes.background: The Government has given permission for GM wheat crops to be tested again in the UK.  The last time they tried this, it did not work and cost the public £3m.  Birds will pick ears and drop them in non-GM fields, which will make normal wheat infertile and will seriously affect organic farms.
attributes.additional_details: The Soil Association, GM Freeze (an association of over 30 organisations) and most UK farmers are totally against GM crops. There is no way to confine this to the planting area, as has been proved in the US and most US farmers have stopped planting this as consumers didn't want it.

attributes.action: all state visits to be approved by parliament before an invite is given.
attributes.background: to avoid the situation the country is in regarding the trump state visit

attributes.action: Stop university grants to be given based on household income in The UK.
attributes.background:
I find it unlawful for the government to think that there is a correlation between University funding and a household income.

A huge majority will have no financial help from these 'dependant people'.
attributes.additional_details:
The aim of this petition is to make the system that is already in place fairer for everyone.

People that want to go to university but won't receive help from these 'dependant people' (from the household income system in place) should not be left short and left to struggle.

attributes.action: Build a link road connecting the M54 to the M6 Toll bypassing Featherstone
attributes.background: The advantages of using the M6 Toll can be negated by delays caused by congestion in Featherstone
attributes.additional_details: The road through Featherstone must produce very excessive pollution to those living along it and it must be dreadful driving in and out of those premises

attributes.action: Make contents insurance mandatory for all council tenants
attributes.background:
We live in a semi detached house which we own.  This is an ex council house. The house that we are attached to is still owned by the Council.

As we have a morgage we have to take out building and contents insurance. 

But if you are a council Tennant you don't have to have insurance of any kind
attributes.additional_details:
The house next door had a very sevier fire and we have been out of our house for a long time

Our insurance covered us for our damage but as there is not any insurance with the next door property our insurance premium will go up

I was not aware that insurance is optional if you are a council tenant and even though none of this is our fault we are the ones left paying the price

Thing's  need to change and I don't think it's too much to ask a council tenant to take responsibility for themselves

attributes.action: Introduce Targeted Sanctions and Travel bans on President Trump and Inner Circle
attributes.background: President Donald Trump is breaching the US constitution, ignoring judicial orders breaking international law and separating families with his executive order revoking visas and has fired the acting Attorney General for refusing to defend an unconstitutional position.
attributes.additional_details:
Targeted sanctions similar to those applied to senior Russian leaders can be used to pressure US leadership to return from the brink of fascism before it is too late. It is important to stand early against tyrants before they can remove democratic checks and balances and the UK needs a democratic USA as ally.

People included in the sanctions should at least include the President, his children, VP, Steven Bannon, the US Cabinet and nominees and the immediate families of all those mentioned.

attributes.action: Stop outstanding council tax debt being passed onto Debt collection agencies.
attributes.background:
Stop outstanding council tax debt being passed onto Debt collection agencies and Bailffs.
If anyone in the UK has or is experiencing any kind of financial difficulties then passing the debt to any Debt collection agency or Bailffs incur extra cost to which adds extra stress and anxiety.

attributes.action: Ban Donald Trump from the UK and tell US House of Representitives to impeach him
attributes.background: The people of the UK, and indeed the world are becoming increasingly alarmed by the beliefs, policies and actions of Donald Trump ( POTUS ) We ask our government to ban Donald Trump from making any visit to the UK, and put pressure on The US House of representitves to impeach Donald Trump.

attributes.action: International students in U.K should have a standard form of maintenance loan
attributes.background: As an international student I've personally been able to experience firsthand economic struggles at university. International students undoubtedly face economic strain with fees & limitations on their economic welfare the government should be able to place a standardised maintenance loan for us.
attributes.additional_details: Increase in international student fees from last year alone at Universities across the country.

attributes.action: Pass: Representation of the People Act - Additional Member System (AMS / MMP)
attributes.background: Our voting system forces the major parties to devote to only swing seats. It doesn't treat voters equally. In parts of the country the opposition parties put up nothing more than a token effort in elections. Regions are dominated by one party despite opponents recording substantial numbers of votes.
attributes.additional_details:
"First past the post has been a huge contributing factor in how remote people feel from politics. As vote share for the major two parties has declined, it is a fact that our general elections have become less and less representative ... It should be a source of national concern that there have been three general elections in history in which the party with the most votes has actually lost the general election."

Source: - http://www.electoral-reform.org.uk/blog/jonathan-reynolds-speech

attributes.action: guarantee all EU football players be exempt from net migration targets
attributes.background: Parliament needs to guarantee that in the forthcoming Brexit negotiations there will be provision made for the free movement of all EU football players to work in UK Football Clubs. A lot of football supporters need reassurance that this group of workers will be exempted from immigration targets.

attributes.action: Make Mr Jeremy Hunt work in a busy hospital for a week so he can see for himself
attributes.background: It seems Mr Jeremy Hunt has an inaccurate view of the NHS and the pressure on it. Before he runs into the ground one of the greatest achievements in world history that is a big part of being British, he should work 12 hour shifts for a week to see how the system needs help.

attributes.action: Lobby the IOC in order for Darts to become an Olympic Sport.
attributes.background: The Secretary of State for Culture, Media and Sport should create a task force in order to lobby the IOC for Darts to be recognised as a sport. They should then have direct involvement in the process of applying to become an Olympic Sport at the earliest opportunity.
attributes.additional_details:
Darts meets almost all requirements stipulated by the Olympic charter.

Sports with similar characteristics are currently already included in the Olympic programme such as Archery and Shooting. Darts is a true test of precision, accuracy, strategy, hand-eye coordination and pressure.

We, the undersigned urge the Government to step in, in order for Darts to have the best chance at becoming an Olympic Sport, and to gain the recognition the sport and it's competitors deserve.

attributes.action: Make the Government cut V.A.T on "ethical" products.
attributes.background: We the undersigned are demanding that the government promise that once we have left the EU and have control over a V.A.T, products which can be considered "ethical" shall have a V.A.T cut in order to make them more affordable for people and families in the U.K.
attributes.additional_details:
They could be products which:

- in their production cause no harm to the environments they are produced in, 
- no harm is caused to any animals which are part of the products production, 
- all parties who help create the product are paid a fair and decent amount in return for their work.

Examples of products like these would be free-range eggs or FairTrade products.
With this, the general public will be more inclined to buy these, as they will be more affordable.

attributes.action: make it illegal to buy or sell animals within 1 month before Christmas
attributes.background: Many animals are sent to shelters as unwanted xmas presents right after xmas
attributes.additional_details: Leeds Dogs trust has received 500 calls re rehoming since xmas and this is just one city and this is repeated all over the country

attributes.action: Stop media companies charging for phone lines with broadband
attributes.background:
All the phone companies force you to take a phone line with your broadband and charge you up to £19 a month on top of your broadband bill.
Even if you don't have a phone line with virgin media they still charge you the same.
BT doesn't have to have a phone line with fibre broadband....

attributes.action: Set a minimum standard for baby change and feed facilities in food outlets
attributes.background: Having seen my wife breastfeed our 3-month old daughter in numerous baby/parent facilities of varying hygiene and quality, I believe there should be a government-set minimum standard for dedicated rooms including all the following - baby change table, toilet, sink, paper towels and a feeding chair.
attributes.additional_details:
John Lewis and Fenwick's are companies setting high standards.  I have visited worse including M&S stores who combine baby facilities with a disabled toilet (no chair/poor hygiene) and Tesco (no toilet), whilst several Costa branches don't have anywhere private to sit so feeding has to be done standing up in the toilet.
As a father I see my wife feeding our baby in conditions that are poor and unhygienic for both parent/child, whilst I experience the lack of toilet facilities in changing areas.

attributes.action: Halt the rise in Southern train fares until the end of the strikes
attributes.background: The strike by ASLEF and RMT has severely affected the quality of the service on Southern Rail and it could be argued that the price of the rail fare should not be increased until such a time when negotiations between Southern Rail and the Unions reach a close.

attributes.action: Introduce 2 part practical driving test, with the inclusion of a motorway test.
attributes.background:
Motorists lack of knowledge of the Highway Code is creating a culture of dangerous driving, which is likely to be the cause of many accidents.

I would like to see the current driving test revised to introduce a new 
2nd part that tests a motorists practical competence of motorway driving.
attributes.additional_details:
A learner driver is prohibited from using a motorway, and their first use of a motorway will only be after they have passed their driving test. Drivers need to be tested on their practical competence and application of the rules before being allowed on motorways alone. 

On a daily basis I witness motorist's breaching rules 264, 267 & 268 of the Highway Code which cover lane discipline and overtaking. DoT report of road traffic accidents shows an increase of people killed or seriously injured.

attributes.action: Bring back the car MOT and tax reminders and make them free!
attributes.background: A while ago the DVLA started using a text messaging system to inform people that their vehicle tax and MOT was due. To my knowledge this feature was soon made a paid subscription. With tax discs now gone innocent good people are forgetting their tax and MOT. In this day and age this should be free!

attributes.action: Withdraw all UK Government funding from PSNI.
attributes.background: Since the 'Good Friday' agreement there has been a total lack of commitment to investigate even-handedly the incidents which occurred during the conflict.  Some terrorists have actually received 'get out of jail' cards - yet the HIT are now concentrating on ex-members of HM Forces.

attributes.action: Introduce CPR and Basic First Aid to the driving test
attributes.background: CPR as well as basic first aid should be a requirement to pass a uk driving test as driving can be a dangerous thing and you never know when you may need to use those skills, which in turn could potentially save someones life

attributes.action: Free to Use Gym Facilities for Under 18s in Full Time Education.
attributes.background: Currently, Childhood Obesity stands at about 20% and could increase just like the last 20 years. I think it should be required to have Gym Facilities in Schools and/or a free membership to Local Gyms for Under 18s in Full Time Education to reduce Obesity in Children and Teenagers.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.itv.com/news/2016-03-21/facts-about-the-uks-growing-obesity-crisis/

http://www.noo.org.uk/NOO_about_obesity/child_obesity

attributes.action: Support a Unilateral Declaration of Independence for the Kurdistan Region
attributes.background:
In order to maintain peace and stability, it is in the vital interest of the west and neighbours to allow the formal process. 

The KRG leadership has declared the need for an imminent referendum; and the region  has proved to be a partner in trade, the fight against terrorism, and peace for all.

attributes.action: Require companies to give paid & undisclosed leave for Dysmenorrhea(period pain)
attributes.background: The higher the amount 'ill' days an employee or a prospective employee has can negatively affect employment. Symptoms are directly related to being a women. Some would say women need to be able to take days off every month without any record of them not working that day and to be paid in full.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2016/mar/02/uk-company-introduce-period-policy-female-staff
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-38207846

http://www.nhs.uk/conditions/Periods-painful/Pages/Introduction.aspx

attributes.action: Allow HMRC to provide tax exemptions where clerical errors have occurred
attributes.background: I dissolved a company rather than wound it up, and therefore HMRC is applying income tax rather than capital gains tax on the distributions. This was a clerical error, but there is no way to wind back the clock on such errors. HMRC should have the power to apply exemptions under such circumstances.

attributes.action: To have a legal maximum temperature in the work place.  A maximum of 25 degrees.
attributes.background: Working for long periods of time in constant heat above 30 degrees can lead to health problems  including headaches, vomiting, lung problems, dry skin.  Having a maximum temperature will result in happier staff and staff not needing yo take as many sick days.
attributes.additional_details: Hopefully it can be included in the health and safety at work act.

attributes.action: Limit the resale of event tickets to a maximum of double the face value
attributes.background: Recently I have attempted to purchase tickets for my favourite artists, only to find that they are sold out in seconds.  If this was by genuine fans, then I'd understand. However, its not.  Immediately on checking Stubhub, there are hundreds available that people are buying to make profits from.
attributes.additional_details: Adele tickets, Face Value £123.00 selling for over £1500 on stub hub within 12 minutes of the sale going live.

attributes.action: Treat all purchases of drones in the same way as firearms
attributes.background:
DRONES are a serious threat to our security 
DRONES currently drop packages into our prisons.
DRONES were the cause of 23 near misses April-October 2015
DRONES hover over private homes, schools and parks
attributes.additional_details:
A former RAF and British Airways pilot warned that a drone hitting an airliner could result in an uncontrolled engine failure or a smashed cockpit windscreen.

A flight safety specialist insisted the large amount of data available is not a true representation of what would happen with a drone because "birds don't have a big lump of lithium battery in them".

The UK Airprox Board (UKAB) has published reports on the incidents, which took place between April 11 and October 4 last year.
